Spotify Audio Features Dataset

audio_features.Rd

This dataset contains audio features for various songs sourced from Spotify, including metadata and audio characteristics. It represents unique song entries, with a total of 29,386 rows and 22 columns.

Usage

data(audio_features)

Format

A data frame with 29,386 rows and 22 variables:

song_id

Unique identifier for each song.

performer

Name of the artist or group performing the song.

song

Title of the song.

spotify_genre

Genre(s) of the song, represented as a list (may include multiple genres).

spotify_track_id

Unique identifier for the track in Spotify's database.

spotify_track_preview_url

URL for a preview of the track.

spotify_track_duration_ms

Duration of the track in milliseconds.

spotify_track_explicit

Logical; Indicates if the track contains explicit content (TRUE or FALSE, may be NA).

spotify_track_album

Title of the album that includes the track.

danceability

Measure of how suitable a track is for dancing, on a scale from 0.0 to 1.0.

energy

Measure of intensity and activity, on a scale from 0.0 to 1.0.

key

Key of the track, represented as an integer.

loudness

Overall loudness of a track in decibels.

mode

Modality of the track, with 1 indicating major and 0 indicating minor.

speechiness

Measure of the presence of spoken words in a track, on a scale from 0.0 to 1.0.

acousticness

Measure of the acoustic nature of a track, on a scale from 0.0 to 1.0.

instrumentalness

Measure of whether a track contains no vocals, on a scale from 0.0 to 1.0.

liveness

Measure of the presence of an audience in the recording, on a scale from 0.0 to 1.0.

valence

Measure of musical positiveness or happiness, on a scale from 0.0 to 1.0.

tempo

Tempo of the track in beats per minute.

time_signature

Time signature of the track, represented as an integer.

spotify_track_popularity

Popularity of the track on a scale from 0 to 100, where 100 is the most popular.

Source

Data sourced from the TidyTuesday project and Spotify's Web API.

Details

The dataset was cleaned to retain only one row per song (song_id), where the first occurrence of each song was selected.

Examples

data(audio_features)
head(audio_features)
